measure.CatchLine: Directs the Department of Justice to include in future budget requests amounts necessary to fund children's advocacy centers, the Survivor Housing Funds grant program and the Oregon Domestic and Sexual Violence Services Fund.
measure.MeasureSummary: Digest: The Act tells DOJ to include in future budget requests amounts to fund various programs that help victims of crime. The Act goes into effect when the Governor signs it. (Flesch Readability Score: 70.3). [Digest: The Act gives money to the DOJ to fund various programs that help victims of crime. The Act goes into effect when the Governor signs it. (Flesch Readability Score: 79.7).] [Appropriates moneys to the Department of Justice to fund certain programs that assist victims of crime.] Directs the Department of Justice to include in future budget requests amounts necessary to fund children's advocacy centers, the Survivor Housing Funds grant program and the Oregon Domestic and Sexual Violence Services Fund. Directs children's advocacy center directors to biennially submit to the department projected costs and estimates of other funding sources for the center. Declares an emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to victims; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to victims; declaring an emergency.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Referred to Judiciary with subsequent referral to Ways and Means.
Recommendation: Do pass with amendments, be printed A-Engrossed, and be referred to Ways and Means by prior reference.
Referred to Ways and Means by prior reference.
Assigned to Subcommittee On Public Safety.
Rules suspended. Third reading. Carried by Kropf. Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 52; Excused, 2--Boshart Davis, Cramer; Excused for Business of the House, 6--Bowman, Dexter, Javadi, Sanchez, Scharf, Speaker Rayfield.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to President's desk.
Recommendation: Do pass the A-Eng. bill.
Rules suspended. Third reading.  Carried by Sollman.  Passed.
